Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a plain discus and an Egyptian ring handle. The shoulder is decorated with a band of impressed ovules and has unpierced lugs. Within the raised base is an impressed foot-print stamp with traces of letters. Covered with a red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1962)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
